title: PERSONAL ADORNMENTS, e.g. JEWELLERY; COINS
special_rules: For classification of additional funtions or features the non-mirror Indexing Code symbols of  should be used.

title: Brooches or clips in their decorative or ornamental aspect
special_rules: Comprises brooches in their decorative aspect. For brooches with a safety pin class in . Comprises decorative ornaments or jewellery to be fastened on clothing.

title: {Badges}
special_rules: In American English "Button" is used for "Badge", correct class for Badges is .For removable buttons that look like badges but are used as a fastener, class in  and in .If they fasten through a safety pin, should also be classed in .
glossary_of_terms: ButtonA knob or stud of metal or other material sewn or fixed by a shank or neck to articles of dress, usually for the purpose of fastening one part of the dress to another by passing through a button-hole, but often merely for ornament.BadgeAny distinctive device, emblem, or mark worn to indicate a person's affiliation, rank, office, name, etc., or membership of an organization or support for a cause; also a small piece of metal, card, plastic, etc., bearing a distinguishing design or words and often worn purely for ornament.

title: {Honorific badges, e.g. ribbon holders for decoration}
special_rules: Comprises honorific medals hold as badges. For medals suspended from chains or ribbons, class in  and lower groups.
definition_statement: This place covers: llustrative example of subject matter classified in this group.

title: {Medals}
special_rules: Comprises only medals which are suspended from chain or ribbon. For honorific medals hold as badges, class in .
